Reviews.Content: Good - worth staying! My husband and I spent a couple of days in Ubud at the Tegal Sari, and when we decided to extend our stay, we found that the previous hotel was completely booked. So we ended up booking for the remainder of our stay at TunJung Mas. We were pleasantly surprised by how wonderful our stay was - the staff was attentive, the rooms were HUGE and clean, and the breakfast was amazing. Actually, the breakfast was potentially one of the best ones we had on the island (DEFINITELY try the chocolate jaffle - it's to die for!). We stayed in room 2, and one of the great things about this room was the 'outdoor shower' feature. Despite its name, the shower only has an outdoorsie feel to it, as it is still indoors. The top of the shower has a big gap where fresh air is let in, and the floor of the shower is covered in smooth rocks. Showering there, you'll feel as though you are in a tropical rain forest, which is fabulous. In general, the hotel is fairly small but spread out, which means that you have the option of privacy and the full attention of staff whenever you need it. Additionally, the rooms are separated by these small pathways surrounded by greenery, so you almost feel like you're walking in a secret garden when you're walking to your room - another thing that makes your stay here feel more intimate, private and romantic. The swimming pool is small, but one end of it is a wall with water cascading down the side of it. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel, and we would definitely consider staying here again.
Reviews.Author: EdgeofExistence

Reviews.Content: I like it! I didn't expect much before I reach Tunjung Mas bungalow. Surprisingly, the room is big, as well as the wash room. Both room and toilet is breezing, especially in the morning. Besides, the landscape is really nice, you can take a lot of pictures even the resort is small. I stayed in first floor, the view is nice. If you like plants, natural, privacy and peace, this is a place for you... I rent a room with USD 48, and I think it's reasonable. Their staffs are friendly and helpful. Things that I don't like is when I have my breakfast at balcony, it's too sunny... no shade unless you wake up early. The swimming pool is a bit small. There are some ants in my room, maybe because too many plants around.The funny part is, my brother stepped on a frog when he walk at night. Your can hear the sounds of insect at night. If I go back to Bali again, may be I will consider stay at the same place.
Reviews.Author: winnee

Reviews.Content: Nice place If you small and intimate hotels, Tunjung Mas is one possible option. The room and shower are big. The staff are very discreet when they go about doing their work. The breakfast is good and is served in the terrace. The rooms are not very soundproof -- I can hear my friends who are staying in the room opposite mine. You are also likely to hear the rest of the guests as they walk past even if you are staying on the second level. One of the problems we faced while staying at Tunjung Mas is the shuttle service. As they only have 1 driver/1car, we need to inform the reception at least half an hour early. If Komang is having his off day, there won't be any drivers. it happened to us during our stay and we had to change our plans. It didn't help that my friend is pregnant and the shuttle service would really be very much appreciated. Upon our request, they arranged another driver but we have to inform them much earlier as he is not stationed at Tunjung Mas. Understandably, given they only have 6 rooms, it does not make much economical sense to have more than one vehicle. Nevertheless, it does affects our holiday mood a little.
Reviews.Author: canriann

Reviews.Content: Nice modern Balinese rooms with friendly, caring staff       View from the bedroom looking out
Reviews.Author: Anit_From_California

Reviews.Content: Good Location, Great Value, A Couple of Things Though I stayed for 3 nights at the end of July 2007. Before staying here I read all the different trip advisor reviews on the different choices, investigated prices through the hotel websites directly and also through third party sites. One of the reasons I chose this place is that I wanted a good location, with a nice, small and quaint Ubud/Balinese feel to it; especially since I was coming from kind of the opposite - Nusa Dua Resort.I'll start with the positive and go into some of the things I disliked below. Overall I don't think I'd stay here again, but that's just because I didn't like a couple of things (again that's below).I think this hotel (only 6 rooms) has quite a bit of charm to it. Although there are some other hotels that have perhaps better views overlooking rice fields or slightly closer to the core of Ubud this one offered great value for the money without really roughing it. I am not a camping type person, do enjoy modern conviences and this place had a nice, pretty large room, very large bathroom, gorgeous grounds (although small b/c only 6 rooms), and was just south of the core of Ubud but still right on the main street so there was lots of stuff even within a 30 second walk - restaurants, stores, a convience store/mini mart. About 10 minutes away walking was the monkey forest, 20 minutes straight walk could get you to the Ubud market.The hotel does provide a shuttle to any place within Ubud free of charge if you ask.In addition, after reading a previous review, I contacted the hotel directly instead of booking through their site and got their deluxe room for $60US, tax incl., breakfast included instead of the $90++ US rate on their website.There was some choice in the breakfast - i.e. toast, balinese waffle equivalent, fresh fruit, eggs, juices, etc. as well as typical balinese breakfast - i.e. fried rice or noodles, etc.Overall the service was very good. I did have a couple of issues with Komang who is the manager. Komang lives at the hotel, not using one of the 6 rooms though, he has another one beside reception. Anyways, I had a couple of issues, one was with a late check out I had arranged, the second was the rate they charge for transport/taxi service.I had arranged for late check out before coming because I had a flight at midnight (red-eye) and wanted to be able to leave for the airport late, clean showered and all. I arranged with Komang a late check out of 6pm in exchange for half the room rate. 6pm was the best he said he could do and I thought the rate was fair. From the second we were checking in Komang said that the room was unfortunately booked immediately after our stay and may not be available for late checkout. I stood ground b/c the late checkout was important to me and we tried to come to a compromise. We decided to discuss it again in a couple of days as we got closer to my departure. We agreed that we'd try to finish up earlier, perhaps 5pm and get out as quickly as possible. They cleaned the room in the morning and we tried not to make a mess in the afternoon so they'd only have to touch up. Anyways, we went back in the early afternoon to sleep for a couple of hours and shower before checkout b/c we can't sleep on planes. At about 3:30pm, I get a call asking if there is any way I can get out of the room now b/c the next guest is here. I though that was pretty rude. We hurried up and showered, closed out our luggage and got out at 4:30 instead. They still charged us for the late checkout. I didn't want to say anything any more at that point. I had even suggested that they should have just offered the next guest half the room rate to compensate for their late check in. It is the hotel's fault for booking the rooms like that.Anyways, the other item is their rate for transportation. They arranged transportation for me to the airport at about a 25% premium to what I could have got walking to curb and flagging a driver so beware that it may be cheaper to arrange your own. This includes aiport pick up. There are set rates at the airport for certain destinations and they are pretty good.The last thing and probably the biggest reason I wouldn't stay at this hotel again is the bathroom. Although the room is air conditioned, the bathroom is not and is somewhat exposed through small openings to the outdoors which did result in some bugs in the bathroom. This included some spiders and cobwebs as well as some ants even on the vanity around our toiletry kits as well as bathtub. I even read something similar in another review and noticed the same thing myself - there were dead bugs smushed on the walls. Why doesn't the cleaning staff take care of cleaning this up! In addition, the bathroom does not have a shower. They have a shower head that you have to hold in your hand which makes things a little more complicated. You soap, then pick up the shower head and rinse, etc. It's just more work. I guess you could always take a bath with the dead bugs in the tub. Also mentioned in other reviews as well is the fact that there is no shower curtain and water does fly every where. I didn't find the latter too bad, I just learned to keep anything you want to keep dry at least 5 or 6 feet away. We just through the towels on the floor after the shower to soak in the water.Overall, this place is good value for the money. The service other than the couple of items mentioned above were good. The rooms are pretty big and air conditioned, some issues for me with the bathroom, breakfast was good, good location, prices negotiable.
Reviews.Author: 14Roger

Reviews.Content: A little disappointing We chose this hotel through Trip Advisor and it's the first time I've felt a bit let down by one of the recommendations. Booking was easy and the staff were lovely but I had expected a clean, well cared for room and I didn't think that is what we had. I wonder if our room was the only one, but there were grubby finger marks on the wall, dirty curtains and squashed mosquitos on the wall. The basic daily cleaning was being done well (sweeping, dusting etc) but I don't think there had been any checking by a manager for some time. After reading the other reviews I wonder if our room was due an overhaul that the other rooms had already received? I would definitely suggest you get a top floor room as from the brief look I had they seemed to be fresher and sunnier.
Reviews.Author: SarahPC

Reviews.Content: Cosy and nice We stayed at Tunjung Mas from 12 - 14June. Overall the place is cosy and compact but I do agree with another review that the beds were very creaky. We booked the ground floor unit and the sound proofing needs improvement as we were subjected to noise of furniture moving by the guests who stayed upstairs. We also agree that Komang the property manager was most hospitable and actually picked us from Nusa Dua to Ubud. The TV programs were all local but Komang made it a point to connect a DVD player for our use.
Reviews.Author: dt

Reviews.Content: Peace and serenity found! My husband and I just got back from Bali yesterday, but we were so impressed with Tunjung Mas that we had to share! Booking with the hotel was a breeze. Komang, the manager, is very efficient, and replied to my email request on the day I sent it, as he did with other emails that I sent. The place itself is peaceful and quiet. Located towards the southern end of Ubud, it is a 20-minute walk to the Ubud market and the frenetic activity at Jalan Raya Ubud, but there are so many shops cafes and restaurants along the way that you tend to forget (until you have to bring all your shopping back....).Tunjung Mas bungalows consists of only 6 units, so you never feel like the place is crowded. We had a ground floor unit, with a private walkway through a small garden. The other comments of other Tripadvisor travellers about the rooms were right on the mark. Our room was large and spotless, and after a day walking about the museums and window-shopping, we really looked forward to returning to the peace and quiet of our hotel room. Our only complaint was the bed: although it was huge, it creaked loudly whenever we tossed and turned. The staff are wonderful, adding their personal touch to the room through carefully placed flowers that were changed daily. The greetings and conversations we shared were sincere and friendly, but never intrusive. Komang, the manager, always took time to ask how our day went. We are regular visitors to Ubud, and we've stayed at various hotels, from budget stays to 4-star resorts, but we must say that in terms of location, value and service, Tunjung Mas is the best so far.
Reviews.Author: Seasinger

Reviews.Content: clean, amazing place We stayed there for 3 nights. It completely exceeds our expectations. It's clean, simplicity, peaceful. Totally no noise could be detected in the room. We were surrounded by breeze, chirm, flower aroma, tropical plants. The room is spacious and simplicity. The kingsize bed is comfy. The bathroom is large and decent.The garden is beautifully aranged. The pool is a little small, but clean and lovely nevertheless.The staff is so friendly and courtesy.It's worthwhile staying here.
Reviews.Author: filliot

Reviews.Content: A clean, bright, and cheerful place. Calling the hotel directly we were offered a deluxe room at $55USD per night for a three night stay (including tax, service, and breakfast) which is a significant discount off the rates listed on their website. Our second storey room had a private entrance and a terrace with seating and a cushioned lounge/napping platform. The room itself was large with a vaulted ceiling and windows all around overlooking the green treetops. Like the bedroom, the bath was very large and windowed with closets and a vanity table. Our only complaint about the facilities was that the tub was not enclosed and there were no shower curtains or wall mount for the handheld shower spout so you pretty much had to shower while seated in the bathtub to prevent water from dousing the room. All facilities in the room were spotless and well maintained.The grounds of the hotel were compact and tidy with lots of local sculpture and a charming swimming pool and rock waterfall. Rooms are located far enough from the road so barely any traffic noise can be detected. Since the property does not have a restaurant the included breakfast (Western or Indonesian choices) was served each morning on our private terrace. A great way to start the day!The hotel is well located on the perimeter of town but within short walking distance of everything. If you do not want to hire a private taxi for onward transport, the hotel is only about 50 meters from the Perama bus terminal which makes it easy and cheap to go anyplace on Bali.
Reviews.Author: globedecker

Reviews.Content: Best in Ubud After a wonderful stay at Tunjung Mas last winter, we returned to this accommodation with friends this year, and they loved it as much as we did!This boutique hotel has only six units (three up and three down). All rooms are bright, airy, and spacious with an upscale minimalist feeling. Our friends said they felt like they were in a five-star hotel in Paradise.The upper units are larger, with huge bathrooms with tubs, and have large balconies. The lower units have Balinese showers and private little walled gardens with a fountain and a day-bed..... and this at very reasonable rates.The location is perfect....minutes from Monkey Forest Road and even close enough to walk to the market, but is very tranquil as it is set back from the street..The staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the manager, Komang goes out of his way to see that his guests are happy. We couldn't have been treated better.This is truly a special place. We felt we had experienced the real Bali. We can hardly wait to return next year!
Reviews.Author: jjude

Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay!!! Just returned last week. From here with the great review we got the idea to book ourselves in Tunjung Mas and stayed there for a straight 5 nights in this wonderful haven. With only 6 rooms to offer and it designed is to give the guests utimate comfort and privacy is to praise for.... We loved every minutes when we were there. Friendly staff, helpful Komang value add to this little great package to cater for everybody who has a chance to stay there. We made our trip at the very last minutes - just 2 days before our departure and lucky to call Komang to ensure us a room to stay when we arrive as well as airport car pick up. Past experiences with Bali hotels reservation staff had told me that we might not hear any confirmation on our email too soon But Komang confirmed our reservation almost instantly with the mindful time of after 7pm just 1 hour after our telephone call. This gave us the assurance that we will be taken care of when we arrived. We fell in love with this property immediately. We highly recommend this place for anyone who want clean, comfort, friendly and beautiful garden.
Reviews.Author: juneraj

Reviews.Content: Clean, simple, great value stayed for two nights last week. Huge clean room with a private garden for ground floor unit. The layout of the different rooms provide excellent privacy. If you don't like stairs and want a small private garden to look at while sitting on the day bed in your patio, get the ground floor units. looking forward to my next stay there!
Reviews.Author: kopiboy

Reviews.Content: Delightful. Exceeded our expectations.       Small sign on Jl Raya Pengosekan
Reviews.Author: ivanoei

Reviews.Content: Tunjung mas bungalows Thank you for recommending me this hotel. I stayed there 5 nights in a deluxe room. Can only praise the place 鈥?pleasant staff beautiful room  bathroom, very large  comfortable, A huge balcony were one can sit  admire the scenery  enjoy the night natural rustles. Shuttle to center of Ubud when needed, The staff very helpful. I enjoyed my stay there.
Reviews.Author: michal5

Reviews.Content: Tunjung Mas--wonderful hotel This hotel was a jewel. We planned to stay at Tegal Sari at the recommendation of a couple of friends we met on Gili Air but arrived to find it full. With luck, the staff there recommended Tunjung Mas Bungalows and we could not have been happier with the accomodation! Lovely, boutique style rooms with wonderful pool,quiet locale, yet convenient just off of Hannoman Street.But most of all, the service was wonderful and the attentive staff made it feel very luxurious! The manager Komang, was delightful and arranged a lovely day tour to Batur and shopping itinerary of our own preferences that included places we would not have found on our own. This is a wonderful as well as reasonable priced(read excellent value) place to stay while in Ubud.
Reviews.Author: palatineboy

Reviews.Content: Tunjung Mas Bungalows a real find We lucked out when we found this accommodation! Tunjung Mas is situated back from Hannemen street behind the Tunjung Mas Gallery, which makes it very quiet. It's an easy walk to Monkey Forest. There are three seperate units consisting of upper and lower accommodation. All units are large, bright and airy. Second floor accommodation is larger,and has a beautiful vauled ceiling, window seat, and tub with hand shower: main floor accommodation has a Balinese shower, and private walled garden with a fountain. Breakfast is included and brought to your unit each morning. Komang, the manager, is most accommodating, and is ready to take care of your every need, as is his staff. We were so pleased with this accommodation we spent the rest of our holiday (13 days)there. We felt sad leaving because of how we had bonded with these wonderful people.
Reviews.Author: julianWinnipeg
